CatDescriptText: William Rowa, unemployed, 49 Dalton Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 4, 1959, pg. A1 "Really, I didn't consider 'Green Pastures' as entertainment, but rather a lesson to keep us from forgetting things which we should remember. However, such parts  of the play like the talk between Noah and The Lord over how many kegs of whiskey to take on the ark should have been censored."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of William Bowra wearing light colored short jacket, dark cap, and moustache, standing with hands in pockets, in front of row house, street no. 1328, with sign reading  "apartment for rent..."
